item.title: Blackjack Strategy: Right or Wrong?
item.description:
At Gambling Teachers, you will learn that basic blackjack strategy is geared to maximizing wins and minimizing losses -- of money, not hands.
Sometimes utilizing basic strategy will actually lose you more hands and sometimes what seems wrong is indeed the right move.
For example, take the hand of Ace-7, a soft 18, against a dealers upcard of 6.
If you stand with the hand, you will win more decisions than if you double the hand. An 18 is a strong hand against a dealers 6.
If you double down, you can only improve your hand by receiving an ace, 2, or 3; if you get a 10 it does not improve it and merely takes the dealers possible bust card, but receiving a 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9 worsens the hand.
So you have a soft 18 and you double down and get a 4. There you are with a 12 and twice as much money out!
Does this make sense? Maybe it does; maybe it does not.

item.title: Poker Dice Lesson at Gambling Teachers
item.description:
Poker Dice is one of the most famous dice games. This lesson at Gambling Teachers details dice history, rules, scoring and strategies.
Poker Dice Rules: A standard dice used is a six-sided cube made of plastic.
The dice display representations of playing cards instead of numbers. Each of the six sides represent Ace, King, Queen, Jack, Ten and Nine that are used to form a Poker hand.
The values in order of rank are Ace, King, Queen, Jack, Ten and Nine.
The object of the game is to make the best poker hand combination from rolls of the Poker Dice. Every player antes up into a pot before rolling.
Each player then rolls five dice at their individual turns and tries to get the best combination with maximum points in different rows.

item.title: Blackjack: Player vs Casino Favorable Rules
item.description:
Gambling Teachers asks the question: Of all the casino games, why learn to play blackjack? What makes it different from any other casino game?
For one, the odds in blackjack are not constant. They keep changing from one hand to the next depending on the cards that have been played.
The bottom line is that blackjack is a game of skill not just luck.
Secondly, not all games are created equal. You will often find different playing rules from one casino to the next and even within the same casino.
Some rules are more player-favorable and others favor the casino.
Its this mix of rules that ultimately determines the casinos overall edge and whether the game is good or bad.
